intro: Daviesia sejugata, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves and is well adapted to dry, sandy soils. It is often found in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in full sun. Daviesia sejugata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
